caption: This experience is quite refreshing!!! Compliments to the chef...the food was hands down the best I’ve had in a while!!! It’s Jamaican cuisine with a sophistication that sets it apart from the rest. customer service was on point, Edward took very good care of us...the ambience is one to take in! Music gave me nostalgia nice mix! The temperature was perfect. Bathrooms very clean and smelled good. Kid friendly environment social distancing is maintained the entire time; I was able to enjoy dining with my daughter and friend without any interaction with other patrons. Brooklyn needed this!! Thank you Chef Simpson and staff!!!

Date night with the hubs 3/31/2020. We were greeted by Lance, made us feel welcomed and safe. I can tell you they take this panny very serious and ensure guest do so as well. Fire stick pepper shrimp - Cod fish fritters - Jerk chicken cheese fries (oh man) our favorite was the JCCF and that was just appetizers. Dinner- 20 oz Dry Aged Cajun Bone in Ribeye and Jerk Oxtail over Macaroni Cheese pie delicious. The finale - Upside down Chocolate bread pudding with vanilla ice cream was the home run for me. Our aim is to go back as much so we can say we had everything on the menu.

I’ve been to this restaurant twice. The first time on Valentine’s Day was good, food and everything. At that time they didn’t serve alcohol as according to them they didn’t get their liquor license yet. Went back there after a month and a half and they still didn’t have liquor license. I ordered the oxtails and rice and peas and was very disappointed. Everything tasted so bland. Not to mention the guava juice from concentrate. That was very disappointing for me.

The food was good, just wish they had their liquor license, maybe a brunch menu. Overall the atmosphere was nice,  staff was attentive although it wasn't busy, so I wouldn't have expected anything less, the chef came and introduced himself asked how we enjoyed our meal.  Will return once they recorder their liquor license
I took my mother here for her birthday. I ordered the rack of ribs and it was delicious. Customer service was excellent and chef Simpson greeted us at our table. An overall pleasant experience.
The staff is attentive and does anything to ensure a good experience. The food is great. Overall, I’ve been to many places but this is definitely the spot for fish and bammy.

Yesterday was my first time going there , I must say its very family oriented. I treated my mom to dinner there she enjoyed it as much as I did. The server was great at helping us decide on what we wanted off the menu, My mom got oxtails with rice and peas & I got curry shrimp with white rice. It was so delicious! Mr.Simpson came to our table and asked us if we were enjoying our food, I thought that was so nice of him. Rarely you’ll get that experience. I will definitely be back !

Went here for a birthday dinner...THEY ARE NOT READY..i dont know why they would let any one reserve a table without telling them they arent serving alcoholic drinks..especially for a birthday..being dishonest also includes with holding information..and we waited a half hour for our checks..they were confused and all over the place..i had jerk chicken with cheese fries..wasnt the best..you guys need to use CHICKEN BREAST..i had to take a few pieces out of my mouth because it felt funny
Good presentation and flavor

Place was splendid. Been there twice already. Had oxtail first time and salmon second time. Can't wait to go back for the roast fish. Let me tell  the bake mac and cheese is the greatest. I loved it on both occasions. Good job ppl.

Omg where do I start.....I loved everything about this restaurant....the food was delicious....big ups to Chef ......I will definitely be back and I can’t wait for the Miami location! Bless up Chef...😇👍🏾 From Chef Trayonna aka the baker !

Oh how I wish I could give no stars ... I was so excited to eat here because we want to support black owned but when I tell you the food was not authentic Jamaican food , very bland. The oxtails were so tough to chew and for the price I would love to have something I can chew and swallow. We also had the salmon which wasn’t fresh it taste like it was cooked then refrigerated and reheated again to serve ( like frozen bag salmon ) Overall the food is way too expensive to not taste good , we can get these meals at your local mom and pop restaurants for half the price and the taste is so flavorful . Not here I won’t even waste my time on going back again very disappointed . Minus 5 stars !

This day started horribly I woke up I was hoarse. Then my 1st appointment the person was late which threw off my entire day.  It was now noon and head nothing accomplished my hair with the mess nails and feet were not done and had dinner reservations or so I thought what I actually had waz a space on a waiting list 2 1/2 hours long. This is to save the day.   Show was able to find last minute reservations at The Simpsons Restaurant. From the door and you that this was a turnaround from the start of my day.We were greeted with warmth and hospitality. Our server Yannick was on point checking in to make sure our meals were to our satisfaction. I had the Escovitch Snapper with veggies and Bammy. It was prepared just right.  Everything was flavorful and fresh and still hot. I'm the pickiest person this side of the Mississippi so I was definitely impressed by the  presentation and taste of everything. My sister's were shocked that I had no complaints. They also enjoyed their meals that i sampled too. They also get an "A" in ambience and music selection. The manager Lance was super personable and visited with all the guest. A-1  Service. Yannick, Lance and a few other staff members brought out a cake 🎂and  sang Happy Birthday (Stevie Wonder edition ❤). What a wonderful ending to my day!!!. My new favorite place.💃🏾🥂😍😍😍😍  HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!! YOU'LL  THANK ME. #THESIMPSONSRESTAURANT #PRIMELOCATION #BESTSERVICE #BESTFOOD #CARIBBEANCUISINE

If you go here you need to definitely try the oxtail and mac and cheese or the ribeye they were both excellent, for the appetizer you should go with pepper shrimp but be prepared for 🔥🔥. The owner and staff are excellent and very accommodating, I will definitely be back soon it was worth the 45 min drive.
Great Customer Service! Mac&cheese was delicious. Coconut shrimp was amazing! I would definitely dine again and again.

This restaurant is fairly new to the Atlantic area, upon entering the establishment we were greeted with a warm smile from the hostess. After being seated our waiter came to the table introduced himself and took our order he was also very welcoming and friendly. The entire staff made us feel like we were  regular guest, the food was amazing we had to tell the chef Patrick how amazing the meal was. After we were done we were able to take a picture with the chef. Definitely recommend this restaurant.
Had a great time the food was everything the staff very pleasant they make you feel at home chef greets you himself 👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍
Excellent service I would visit again food was sooo good I has the steak n I had the wings platter too

Had an overall great experience for my birthday dinner. It did take us a little long to get our food, although we're a big party (12 persons). Lance, the Manager was amazing though, kept checking in to ensure was okay and is really very pleasant. Food was also good, liked the many different options.
Everything was delicious as expected. Chef Simpson is the best hands down. Everyone needs to go here for a great experience. Thanks Chef 😊🙏🏽

I have been following Chef Simpson for a while on social media so I was excited for the opportunity to visit the restaurant. My husband and I arrived around 7:30pm on a Sunday, February 21. The restaurant was fairly empty-besides us, there were two tables with large parties and about four other couples dining in. We were greeted warmly and completed Covid protocols (temperature check, sanitizer and tracing info). We were seated in a booth and introduced to our server. We ordered the codfish fritters for an appetizer. They were good but a little on the crunchier side than I prefer. I had the jerk chicken entree which was really tasty though I wished it were made the authentic way on a grill and not in the oven. The portion of chicken was filling. My husband had the curry salmon which he enjoyed. The restaurant is still awaiting a liquor license so they could only offer mocktails and fountain drinks. I had the sorrel which was tasty but literally took two sips and it was done-for $4, the drinks should come in larger sizes. For dessert, we tried the cake which also tasted good but we couldn’t finish it because it was unnecessarily covered in a bunch of chocolate and caramel syrup which made it too sweet and was totally unnecessary. They syrup was not included in the description of the dessert. When I told my server about that, he said, “Oh, they just want to make it pretty”. My husband wanted an ice cream scoop to go with the cake however the menu lists gelato, not ice-cream. The server couldn’t really tell the different and insisted that it was ice-cream. He ended up not getting it because  he didn’t want to have gelato. I have high hopes that The Simpson will be a great restaurant once they work out some of the kinks. Dinner for two here is pretty pricey considering no alcohol was consumed. Still, I would recommend that you give it a try. The customer service is good and the chef seems like a wonderful person though we did not get to meet him during our visit.

Hello folks welcome all new people new eye balls and new beeeeeeeeeeeeez thanks for reading my post okay nice huge restaurant here very big all food taste good here a real professional chef here and he is famous me simpson the world's famous chef he has his own restaurant here very clean music is fly watch tv the bar is huge very cool staff and workers here words can't even begin to explain to you it's worth it prices is fair family friendly bring the kids grandpa grandma dad mother father son daughter you get the picture come in folks let's eat don't be scared if the plate grab a spoon folk so if you are near hear come on down  until the next time peace

My friends and I heard about this place and decided to go for dinner for a late birthday celebration. Sweet jesus, the customer service was great. Our server Monty was everything; energy on a 100; he made sure to check in on us often as we was waiting for our food. First off, the appetizers was AMAZING; the jerk wings, jerk chicken cheese fries and cod fish fritters...delicious. Then our entree was even better. Definitely will be back soon. Monty, thank you for the well service. I also want to extend my thanks to the owner Wenford for exceptional services as he was prompt and professional in taking care of my experience there. Congratulations to The Simpson for bringing some sweetness and good food  during these difficult times.
First time here however It was a evening well spent. Edward provided such great service and the food was off the chain Will definitely be coming back

I had lunch .. easy commute, place is spacious n tastefully decorated, service good n food great . For start I had the bammy with ackee n salt fish followed by oxtail cooked with butter beans (🌶/nice)  served with rice n peas n veggie. I also had the sorrel💥💥! . Considering location n quality of food I believe price is reasonable. Definitely worth repeating!!!
No liquor license
(Translated by Google) Good place  (Original) Buen lugar
Great hospitality Good and tasty food Beautiful staff Excellent service

Chef Simpson and his staff were excellent. The service was exceptional. Omg the food is amazing. My new favorite place to eat and have a great time. I am beyond Grateful and thankful for the wonderful accommodations. Will see you soon.

This was my first time! I was super excited to meet celebrity chef Simpson .  Very good customer service. However, I was disappointed with my order . The fried shrimp was not fully cooked. The escovish fish was oily “swimming “. The jerk wings were not fully cooked . I dinned in and the service was great , but the food didn’t meet my expectations... I wish it did . Maybe next time I will order something different.   All the best ... blessings

I had a great time at the Simpson Restaurant and bar. The staff was inviting and professional. I liked the diversity of the menu, Caribbean, pasta,  seafood,  etc. Lots of entrées to choose from. I'll definitely be back.

We had an awesome time celebrating my daughter's birthday at The Simpson Restaurant and Bar. We were treated well the minute we walked in to the very last minute when we left. We had a variety of dishes and not one complaint. We'll be back.

The service was Horrible. Got seated at 815 reservations was at pm. No problem at all.  We waited for a server until 845pm. Finally took all orders from the table. (Drinks, appetizers, and entre). 915 still no drinks, didn't see the server again until the appetizers came around 940pm Still no drinks, water or utensils and not all the appetizers. We decided to pay for our appetizers and leave. We asked for the manager but he never came. The serve explained it was only two people working on a Saturday March 6 2021. We paid for the appetizers then the food arrived. It was 1035 now. We were done we all left the location unhappy and hungry. All the attention was given to the front of the restaurant and the back was neglected  such a bad bad experience especially when the ig page shows different
My friends and I had a great time. The experience exceeded our expectations. We will be back!
Wheres the Alcohol i was atleast looking for a Red Stripe, Guinness or any kind of wine smh.
Great food and bar for drinks just open great location on downtown Brooklyn cross street from Barclay's center.  Seafood is a must try

Horrible service. We sat at our table for over 2 hours and more waiting for appetizers and food to come, that never came we asked to speak to the manager on several occasions he never showed up but we saw him with the red coat when we was leaving he still didn't address the matter. AND what made it bad the place wasnt crowded. So i will never return here, they don't serve no alcohol n the service was Horrible

The food was very bland. I wanted to taste real authentic Caribbean food. The owner was amazing. I had the snapper fish and it had no seasoning at all. Maybe i’ll give it another chance later on it hopes it will be better.
Very good experience for my first time there. Very spacious and staff friendly...chef came to introduce himself. Very professional. Will be back very soon.
The food was great and the dessert tasted really good.
If I could rate it 10 stars I would... treated myself to lunch and it was worth every penny and then some 🙌🏽
Great place amazing service
